intro: Calochortus aureus, commonly known as the golden cupcup, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. Its flowers are surrounded by a cup-like structure formed by the fused petals, which gives it its common name. Calochortus aureus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
